head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #33

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #33 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Remarks on board the Schooner Nancy hired Transport on her passage to St Marie's in the month of November 1813[.]

Fore part of this day moderate breezes at East at 8 AM loosed the topsails, s: sail & jibbs to dry hove up, hung the boat in tackles, & at ½ past noon succeed in getting up the rappids, at ½ past 1 PM pass over the bar find 6 feet, heave the last of the ballast overboard at 5 in sight of the welcome Islands, fresh breezes at ESE unbent Fore, T: G: sail, & sent it down ½ p at 6 come to at St Maries with the best bower, handed all sail – at 8 set the watch – this day has been one of the clearest since 20th Septer – & more of the Sun than for a few weeks part – Moon also[.]

Fore & latter part of this day, cloudy thick weather threatening rain, wind variable from NE: to South & moderate – commenced unbending sails & unrigging took all the sails & spars ashore, stripped all but the lower masts – no watch is kept[.]
Fore & latter part of this day, cloudy, thick weather, at intervals, accompanied with rain no duty done on board this day, wind variable all day – from the Westward[.]

Fore & latter part of this day, dark dull & disagreeable weather, wind at SE & light – showery at times, took some sugar, & rigging ashore & cleared the hold – in the afternoon men were employed washing, & getting boards for fitting up a room for the winter[.]

Fore part of this day laid & moored the vessel in her birth for the winter, go to the Scho: Mink attempt to get her off, find the water to low, return to the Nancy and commence sending down the last of the main rigging – very cold chilly winds from the Northwa[rd.]

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
